info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 15 at 12:29AM CDT until May 15 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Hastings NE
info.description:
* WHAT...Possible flooding caused by earlier excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of central Nebraska, including the following county, Valley.
* WHEN...Until 400 AM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas, along with possible flooding along small creeks and streams.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1222 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated that heavy rain from earlier in the evening had moved out of the area, with very little rain expected through the rest of the night. However, minor flooding from as much as 2 to 4 inches of earlier rain is likely still ongoing at this time. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Turtle Creek, Hawthorne Creek, Dane Creek. - Some locations that could experience flooding include... Elyria and Fort Hartsuff State Park, but especially rural areas of west-central and northwestern Valley County. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING
